question: My daughter was having some issues while urinating so I took her to the doctor because I thought it was a kidney infection.  They ran tests on her kidneys, bladder and urethia and everything is fine but they also did a fasting glucose test and the doctor said it came back a 1.3 or 103 (I am having trouble dealing with the thought of this so I can't remember) anyway she said that was elevated for a fasting glucose level in a female her age so we have now done glucose and insulin tests which will not be back for several days.  The doctor also said production of alot of yeast is a sign in young females and my daughter does that.I read in one posting that you will really know if they have it you can not miss the signs can you please elaborate as I have googled and can not really find anything.
title: Testing my 12 year old daughter for juvenile diabetes
